answers.author: [Unknown]
answers.text:
Hi Michael, 
Thank you for your question council by-laws, ICMA has many examples of council by laws on the Knowledge Network. 

Maryland City/County By-Laws (http://icma.org/en/md/about/bylaws)
-By Laws of the City of Clearwater (icma.org/Documents/QuestionAnswer/Document/10587)
-Cal-ICMA City By-Laws (http://icma.org/en/ca/about/bylaws)

I hope you find these useful and there are many more on the Knowledge Network if you would like more examples. 
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern 
rsaywitz@icma.org

answers.author: Murray Levison
answers.text:
I've attached the City of Sacramento's council rules of procedure which is updated annually. The rules cover how electeds and staff are to conduct themselves, how meeting agendas are to be developed and formatted, how meetings are conducted, how membership in council committees and regional organizations is determined, and how council committees operate.


I've attached the City of Sacramento's council rules of procedure which is updated annually. The rules cover how electeds and staff are to conduct themselves, how meeting agendas are to be developed and formatted, how meetings are conducted, how membership in council committees and regional organizations is determined, and how council committees operate.

author: Michael Maniscalco
text: Does anyone work with a Council that has a set of bylaws that they follow? Our Council is looking to develop some rules (a little more than Roberts rules) that they can operate under. Any suggestions would help.
title: Council By-Laws
